verses.kjv: Lord, thou hast been our dwelling place in all generations.
verses.ct: Lord, you have been our refuge throughout every generation.

verses.kjv: Before the mountains were brought forth, or ever thou hadst formed the earth and the world, even from everlasting to everlasting, thou art God.
verses.ct: Before the mountains were born, before you formed the earth and the world, from eternity past to eternity future, you are God.

verses.kjv: Thou turnest man to destruction; and sayest, Return, ye children of men.
verses.ct: You turn people back to dust, saying, 'Return to the ground, descendants of humanity.'

verses.kjv: For a thousand years in thy sight are but as yesterday when it is past, and as a watch in the night.
verses.ct: A 1,000 years in your perspective are like a single day already gone, like a few hours of the night.

verses.kjv: Thou carriest them away as with a flood; they are as a sleep: in the morning they are like grass which groweth up.
verses.ct: You sweep people away like a flood; they are like a dream. In the morning they spring up like grass.

verses.kjv: In the morning it flourisheth, and groweth up; in the evening it is cut down, and withereth.
verses.ct: In the morning it thrives and grows tall; by evening it is cut down and dries up.

verses.kjv: For we are consumed by thine anger, and by thy wrath are we troubled.
verses.ct: We are destroyed by your anger and overwhelmed by your wrath.

verses.kjv: Thou hast set our iniquities before thee, our secret sins in the light of thy countenance.
verses.ct: You have placed our wrongdoings right in front of you, our hidden sins exposed in the full light of your presence.

verses.kjv: For all our days are passed away in thy wrath: we spend our years as a tale that is told.
verses.ct: All our days slip away under your wrath; we finish our years like a sigh.

verses.kjv: The days of our years are threescore years and ten; and if by reason of strength they be fourscore years, yet is their strength labour and sorrow; for it is soon cut off, and we fly away.
verses.ct: Our lifespan is 70 years, or 80 if we have the strength — yet even the best of those years are filled with struggle and sorrow, because life passes quickly and then we are gone.

verses.kjv: Who knoweth the power of thine anger? even according to thy fear, so is thy wrath.
verses.ct: Who truly grasps the force of your anger? Your wrath matches the reverence you deserve.

verses.kjv: So teach us to number our days, that we may apply our hearts unto wisdom.
verses.ct: So teach us to value each day we have, so that we may develop hearts of wisdom.

verses.kjv: Return, O LORD, how long? and let it repent thee concerning thy servants.
verses.ct: Come back to us, LORD — how much longer? Show compassion to your servants.

verses.kjv: O satisfy us early with thy mercy; that we may rejoice and be glad all our days.
verses.ct: Fill us each morning with your mercy, so we can sing for joy and be happy for the rest of our lives.

verses.kjv: Make us glad according to the days wherein thou hast afflicted us, and the years wherein we have seen evil.
verses.ct: Give us joy equal to the days you let us suffer, equal to the years we experienced hardship.

verses.kjv: Let thy work appear unto thy servants, and thy glory unto their children.
verses.ct: Let your servants see what you are doing, and let their children witness your glory.

verses.kjv: And let the beauty of the LORD our God be upon us: and establish thou the work of our hands upon us; yea, the work of our hands establish thou it.
verses.ct: May the kindness of the Lord our God rest on us. Make the work of our hands successful — yes, make the work of our hands succeed.
